snippet: Alarmed over the rising human death toll from the Middle East Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus, authorities in Saudi Arabia, said they would start testing the kingdom’s entire population of camels.
abstract: Authorities in Saudi Arabia, alarmed over rising death toll from Middle East Respiratory Syndrome coronavirus, say they will start testing entire population of camels and other livestock in kingdom.
lead_paragraph: Alarmed over the rising human death toll from the Middle East Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus, authorities in Saudi Arabia, said they would start testing the kingdom’s entire population of camels.

headline.main: Saudi Arabia: Camels and Livestock Are to Be Tested for Traces of a Virus
headline.print_headline: Saudi Arabia: Camels and Livestock Are to Be Tested for Traces of a Virus
